Toxoplasmosis
Toxoplasmosis is a common 
infection that you can 
catch from the following 
sources: - Cat faeces: soil 
or litter in contact with cat 
faeces may contain the 
parasite, consuming raw or 
undercooked meat containing 
parasitic cysts; contaminated 
water; unpasteurised milk or its 
products, especially goatâ€™s milk; 
eating raw, unwashed fruits or 
vegetables which have been in 
contact with contaminated soil
